reviews.text:
Mee Goreng (SGD $9) @ Thohirah Restaurant.
.
Established in November 2005, this well-known fast-casual restaurant is a late night supper place.
.
Their rendition veers towards the 'dry' style, non-greasy, with yellow noodles tossed with bean sprouts, chye sim / Chinese flowering cabbage, chicken egg, potato cubes, beef slices, and red chili. Topped with a fried egg and cucumbers.
.
Has nice chewy soft tender crisp textures, with smoky grainy sweet salty meaty savoury vegetal spice eggy flavour.

Average prata. Portion quite big.
Chicken mutaabak filled with dry chicken breast meat and quite bland. Bryiyani fried chicken thigh also quite dry, but rice is fragrant.

The place is ok to dine in, there's even an aircon place.

We ordered 3 plain prata ($1.70 each), 2 egg prata ($2.70 each), mee goreng with no meat ($5.70, add $3 for beef or chicken), 10 satay plus ketupat ($1.20 per satay for beef, mutton or chicken, $1.30 per ketupat), 1 teh halia ($2). Sounded like quite a lot cause I broke down the prices one by one, but you can see for yourself in the photo. We wanted a light dinner, and the proportion was alright, but the price was not. It's too pricey to be $31.50 for only these.

Scores (purely based on taste and not taking price into consideration, which all scores would go down to 1 or 2 over 5)
Plain prata: 3/5 - I'm ok that the flour is a little tough and chewy, but may not be elderly friendly. Definitely not the kind to go for if you like crispy prata.
Egg prata: 3.5/5 - slightly better than plain prata in terms of flavour and texture with the help of egg.
Mee goreng: 4/5 - it's quite flavourful for a plain mee goreng with no meat, but some may find it spicy
Satay: 2/5 - dad says mutton meat too tough. Chicken meat was lean, but ok for me.
Ketupat: 2/5 - hard, not steamed thoroughly?

All in all, likely will go back again if the standard is like this.

Typically prefer dum briyani but got the regular mutton briyani instead to save some money. Not a fan of their achar, it's kinda blend. Briyani rice, curry and mutton was good. There's a "big" piece of mutton but it's mostly bone with not much meat. Will be better if give more curry.

A great spot for plain and egg prata (flatbread) served with fish curry. The vegetable murtabak was the standout dishâ€”fluffy and generously filled with potatoes, onions, cauliflower, and button mushrooms. The mee goreng, though, was just average and didn't deliver the spiciness I was hoping for.
